comments.body:
I'm not sure this is the right approach - if this isn't transient for some reason, the we may be operating on very stale data...

Thinking more about this - maybe this particular codepath is fine. But I would like to avoid returning stale results.
So maybe we can modify the get path to return "unknown" or sth like in case the data is too old.

> But I would like to avoid returning stale results.
So maybe we can modify the get path to return "unknown" or sth like in case the data is too old.

with the pruning period set to `1h` - if this is not a transient error then after 1h the count will get stale and be removed from the cache, and then Get will return `0, false`. I think we are good, in the worst case we will use stale data for an hour and then will continue to return 'count not known` until the issue gets fixed.
